title: should provide a more meaningful error message if get fails
body:
I think we had that discussion but atm it is completely not usable
```shell
$> datalad get 123
                                                                                                                                                                      [ERROR  ] (Note that these git remotes have annex-ignore set: origin) [get(/tmp/test-dart1-clone/123)] 
get(error): /tmp/test-dart1-clone/123 (file) [(Note that these git remotes have annex-ignore set: origin)]
```
```shell
$> git annex whereis 123                                                                                                
whereis 123 (2 copies) 
  	6de4a4d9-88b8-4588-996b-bcfa948f0b58 -- box-dartm
   	95fa7648-8b0b-4d17-b420-7c8769cdcdcd -- yoh@hopa:/tmp/test-dart1
ok

```
so we could go through files which failed to get and summarize their whereis output to list which remotes should have those files and might need to be enabled.
